intro: Guatteria parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Panama. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Guatteria parviflora is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
